data.name: ConfigCommandDesc
data.value: Gets or sets NuGet config values.

data.name: ConfigCommandExamples
data.value: nuget config -Set HTTP_PROXY=http://127.0.0.1 -Set HTTP_PROXY.USER=domain\user nuget.config HTTP_PROXY

data.name: ConfigCommandSetDesc
data.value: One on more key-value pairs to be set in config.

data.name: ConfigCommandAsPathDesc
data.value: Returns the config value as a path. This option is ignored when -Set is specified.

data.name: ConfigCommandSummary
data.value: <-Set name=value | name>

data.name: DeleteCommandDescription
data.value: Deletes a package from the server.

data.name: DeleteCommandNoPromptDescription
data.value: Do not prompt when deleting.

data.name: DeleteCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Specifies the server URL.

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the Id and version of the package to delete from the server.

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget delete MyPackage 1.0
nuget delete MyPackage 1.0 -NoPrompt

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <package Id> <package version> [API Key] [options]

data.name: HelpCommandAll
data.value: Print detailed help for all available commands.

data.name: HelpCommandDescription
data.value: Displays general help information and help information about other commands.

data.name: HelpCommandMarkdown
data.value: Print detailed all help in markdown format.

data.name: HelpCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Pass a command name to display help information for that command.

data.name: HelpCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget help
nuget help push
nuget ?
nuget push -?

data.name: HelpCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [command]

data.name: InstallCommandDescription
data.value: Installs a package using the specified sources. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in the NuGet configuration file are used. If the configuration file specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet feed.

data.name: InstallCommandExcludeVersionDescription
data.value: If set, the destination folder will contain only the package name, not the version number

data.name: InstallCommandNoCache
data.value: Disable using the machine cache as the first package source.

data.name: InstallCommandOutputDirDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory in which packages will be installed. If none specified, uses the current directory.

data.name: InstallCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allows prerelease packages to be installed. This flag is not required when restoring packages by installing from packages.config.

data.name: InstallCommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of packages sources to use for the install.

data.name: InstallCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the id and optionally the version of the package to install. If a path to a packages.config file is used instead of an id, all the packages it contains are installed.

data.name: InstallCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget install elmah
nuget install packages.config
nuget install ninject -o c:\foo

data.name: InstallCommandUsageSummary
data.value: packageId|pathToPackagesConfig [options]

data.name: InstallCommandVersionDescription
data.value: The version of the package to install.

data.name: ListCommandAllVersionsDescription
data.value: List all versions of a package. By default, only the latest package version is displayed.

data.name: ListCommandDescription
data.value: Displays a list of packages from a given source. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config are used. If NuGet.config specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet feed.

data.name: ListCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allow prerelease packages to be shown.

data.name: ListCommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of packages sources to search.

data.name: ListCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify optional search terms.

data.name: ListCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget list
nuget list -verbose -allversions

data.name: ListCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [search terms] [options]

data.name: ListCommandVerboseListDescription
data.value: Displays a detailed list of information for each package.

data.name: Option_NonInteractive
data.value: Do not prompt for user input or confirmations.

data.name: Option_Verbosity
data.value: Display this amount of details in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.

data.name: PackageCommandBasePathDescription
data.value: The base path of the files defined in the nuspec file.

data.name: PackageCommandBuildDescription
data.value: Determines if the project should be built before building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandDescription
data.value: Creates a NuGet package based on the specified nuspec or project file.

data.name: PackageCommandExcludeDescription
data.value: Specifies one or more wildcard patterns to exclude when creating a package.

data.name: PackageCommandExcludeEmptyDirectories
data.value: Prevent inclusion of empty directories when building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandNoDefaultExcludes
data.value: Prevent default exclusion of NuGet package files and files and folders starting with a dot e.g. .svn.

data.name: PackageCommandNoRunAnalysis
data.value: Specify if the command should not run package analysis after building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandOutputDirDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory for the created NuGet package file. If not specified, uses the current directory.

data.name: PackageCommandPropertiesDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to specify a semicolon ";" delimited list of properties when creating a package.

data.name: PackageCommandSymbolsDescription
data.value: Determines if a package containing sources and symbols should be created. When specified with a nuspec, creates a regular NuGet package file and the corresponding symbols package.

data.name: PackageCommandToolDescription
data.value: Determines if the output files of the project should be in the tool folder.

data.name: PackageCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the location of the nuspec or project file to create a package.

data.name: PackageCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <nuspec | project> [options]

data.name: PackageCommandVerboseDescription
data.value: Shows verbose output for package building.

data.name: PackageCommandVersionDescription
data.value: Overrides the version number from the nuspec file.

data.name: PackCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget pack
nuget pack foo.nuspec
nuget pack foo.csproj
nuget pack foo.csproj -Build -Symbols -Properties Configuration=Release
nuget pack foo.nuspec -Version 2.1.0

data.name: PushCommandDescription
data.value: Pushes a package to the server and optionally publishes it.

data.name: PushCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Specifies the server URL. If not specified, nuget.org is used unless DefaultPushSource config value is set in the NuGet config file.

data.name: PushCommandTimeoutDescription
data.value: Specifies the timeout for pushing to a server in seconds. Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes).

data.name: PushCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the path to the package and your API key to push the package to the server.

data.name: PushCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget push foo.nupkg 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a
nuget push foo.nupkg 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a -s http://customsource/
nuget push foo.nupkg
nuget push foo.nupkg.symbols
nuget push foo.nupkg -Timeout 360

data.name: PushCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <package path> [API key] [options]

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandDescription
data.value: Saves an API key for a given server URL. When no URL is provided API key is saved for the NuGet gallery.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Server URL where the API key is valid.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the API key to save and an optional URL to the server that provided the API key.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget setapikey 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a
nuget setapikey 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a -Source http://example.com/nugetfeed

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <API key> [options]

data.name: SourcesCommandDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to manage list of sources located in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config

data.name: SourcesCommandNameDescription
data.value: Name of the source.

data.name: SourcesCommandPasswordDescription
data.value: Password to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SourcesCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Path to the package(s) source.

data.name: SourcesCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <List|Add|Remove|Enable|Disable|Update> -Name [name] -Source [source]

data.name: SourcesCommandUserNameDescription
data.value: UserName to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SpecCommandAssemblyPathDescription
data.value: Assembly to use for metadata.

data.name: SpecCommandDescription
data.value: Generates a nuspec for a new package. If this command is run in the same folder as a project file (.csproj, .vbproj, .fsproj), it will create a tokenized nuspec file.

data.name: SpecCommandForceDescription
data.value: Overwrite nuspec file if it exists.

data.name: SpecCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget spec
nuget spec MyPackage
nuget spec -a MyAssembly.dll

data.name: SpecCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [package id]

data.name: UpdateCommandDescription
data.value: Update packages to latest available versions. This command also updates NuGet.exe itself.

data.name: UpdateCommandIdDescription
data.value: Package ids to update.

data.name: UpdateCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allows updating to prerelease versions. This flag is not required when updating prerelease packages that are already installed.

data.name: UpdateCommandRepositoryPathDescription
data.value: Path to the local packages folder (location where packages are installed).

data.name: UpdateCommandSafeDescription
data.value: Looks for updates with the highest version available within the same major and minor version as the installed package.

data.name: UpdateCommandSelfDescription
data.value: Update the running NuGet.exe to the newest version available from the server.

data.name: UpdateCommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of package sources to search for updates.

data.name: UpdateCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget update
nuget update -Safe
nuget update -Self

data.name: UpdateCommandVerboseDescription
data.value: Show verbose output while updating.

data.name: CommandApiKey
data.value: The API key for the server.

data.name: DefaultConfigDescription
data.value: NuGet's default configuration is obtained by loading %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config, then loading any nuget.config or .nuget\nuget.config starting from root of drive and ending in current directory.

data.name: InstallCommandRequireConsent
data.value: Checks if package restore consent is granted before installing a package.

data.name: InstallCommandSolutionDirectory
data.value: Solution root for package restore.

data.name: Option_ConfigFile
data.value: The NuGet configuration file. If not specified, file %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config is used as configuration file.

data.name: InstallCommandDisableParallel
data.value: Disable parallel nuget package installs.

data.name: PackageCommandMinClientVersion
data.value: Set the minClientVersion attribute for the created package.

data.name: PackageCommandIncludeReferencedProjects
data.value: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package.

data.name: UpdateCommandFileConflictAction
data.value: Set default action when a file from a package already exists in the target project. Set to Overwrite to always overwrite files. Set to Ignore to skip files. If not specified, it will prompt for each conflicting file.
